register.description: Lower byte of USB-IF-supplied 16-bit vendor ID Value is set for all channels. Default is Texas Instruments Vendor ID = 0x0451.
Lower byte of USB-IF-supplied 16-bit vendor ID Value is set for all channels. Default is Texas Instruments Vendor ID = 0x0451.
Upper byte of USB-IF-supplied 16-bit vendor ID Value is set for all channels. Default is Texas-Instruments Vendor ID = 0x0451.
Upper byte of USB-IF-supplied 16-bit vendor ID Value is set for all channels. Default is Texas-Instruments Vendor ID = 0x0451.
Lower byte of 16-bit product ID Value is set for all channels. Default is
Lower byte of 16-bit product ID Value is set for all channels. Default is
Upper byte of 16-bit product ID Value is set for all channels. Default is
Upper byte of 16-bit product ID Value is set for all channels. Default is
Controls UTMI function settings of the PHY. Read/write address.

bitfield.description: Active low PHY suspend: puts the ULPI bus in low-power mode. Automatically set back to 1 upon low-power mode exit.

bitenum.description: PHY is not in low-power mode.

bitfield.description: Active high UTMI transceiver reset. Auto-cleared. Does not reset the ULPI interface or ULPI register set.
Select the required bit encoding style during transmit
Controls the internal 1.5-kΩ HS terminations. Control over bus resistors changes depending on XcvrSelect, OpMode, DpPulldown and DmPulldown.
Select the required transceiver speed.

bitenum.description: Enable FS transceiver for LS packets (automatic FS preamble prepending)

register.description: Controls UTMI function settings of the PHY. Read/write address.

bitfield.description: Active low PHY suspend: puts the ULPI bus in low-power mode. Automatically set back to 1 upon low-power mode exit.

bitenum.description: PHY is not in low-power mode.

bitfield.description: Active high UTMI transceiver reset. Auto-cleared. Does not reset the ULPI interface or ULPI register set.
Select the required bit encoding style during transmit
Controls the internal 1.5-kΩ HS terminations. Control over bus resistors changes depending on XcvrSelect, OpMode, DpPulldown and DmPulldown.
Select the required transceiver speed.

bitenum.description: Enable FS transceiver for LS packets (automatic FS preamble prepending)

register.description: Controls UTMI function settings of the PHY. Read/set address (write 1 to a bit to set it to 1, writing 0 has no effect on bit value). See the field description at the read/write address of the same register.

bitfield.description: Active low PHY suspend: Puts the ULPI bus in low-power mode. Automatically set back to 1 upon low-power mode exit.
Active high UTMI transceiver reset. Autocleared. Does not reset the ULPI interface or ULPI register set.
Select the required bit encoding style during transmit.
Controls the internal 1.5-kΩ pullup resistor and 45-Ω HS terminations. Control over bus resistors changes depending on XcvrSelect, OpMode, DpPulldown and DmPulldown.
Select the required transceiver speed.

register.description: Controls UTMI function settings of the PHY. Read/set address (write 1 to a bit to set it to 1, writing 0 has no effect on bit value). See the field description at the read/write address of the same register.

Active high UTMI transceiver reset. Autocleared. Does not reset the ULPI interface or ULPI register set.
Select the required bit encoding style during transmit.
Controls the internal 1.5-kΩ pullup resistor and 45-Ω HS terminations. Control over bus resistors changes depending on XcvrSelect, OpMode, DpPulldown and DmPulldown.
Select the required transceiver speed.

register.description: Controls UTMI function settings of the PHY. Read/clear address (write 1 to a bit to clear it to 0, writing 0 has no effect on bit value). See the field description at the read/write address of the same register.

bitfield.description: Active low PHY suspend: Puts the ULPI bus in low-power mode. Automatically set back to 1 upon low-power mode exit.
Active high UTMI transceiver reset. Autocleared. Does not reset the ULPI interface or ULPI register set.
Select the required bit encoding style during transmit
Controls the internal 1.5-kΩ pull-up resistor and 45-Ω HS terminations. Control over bus resistors changes depending on XcvrSelect, OpMode, DpPulldown and DmPulldown.
Select the required transceiver speed.

register.description: Controls UTMI function settings of the PHY. Read/clear address (write 1 to a bit to clear it to 0, writing 0 has no effect on bit value). See the field description at the read/write address of the same register.

bitfield.description: Active low PHY suspend: Puts the ULPI bus in low-power mode. Automatically set back to 1 upon low-power mode exit.
Active high UTMI transceiver reset. Autocleared. Does not reset the ULPI interface or ULPI register set.
Select the required bit encoding style during transmit
Controls the internal 1.5-kΩ pull-up resistor and 45-Ω HS terminations. Control over bus resistors changes depending on XcvrSelect, OpMode, DpPulldown and DmPulldown.
Select the required transceiver speed.

register.description: Enables alternative interfaces and PHY features. Read/write address.

bitfield.description: Controls circuitry built into the PHY for protecting the ULPI interface when the link 3-states stp and data.
Enables the PHY to automatically drive resume signaling. On by default.
Active low clock suspend for serial modes (6-pin/3-pin).

bitenum.description: ULPI clock will stop during serial modes.
ULPI clock will run during serial modes.

bitfield.description: Sets the ULPI interface to 3-pin (FS/LS only) serial mode. Auto-cleared when serial mode is exited.
Sets the ULPI interface to 6-pin (FS/LS only) serial mode. Auto-cleared when serial mode is exited.

register.description: Enables alternative interfaces and PHY features. Read/write address.

bitfield.description: Controls circuitry built into the PHY for protecting the ULPI interface when the link 3-states stp and data.
Enables the PHY to automatically drive resume signaling. On by default.

bitenum.description: ULPI clock will stop during serial modes.
ULPI clock will run during serial modes.

bitfield.description: Sets the ULPI interface to 3-pin (FS/LS only) serial mode. Auto-cleared when serial mode is exited.
Sets the ULPI interface to 6-pin (FS/LS only) serial mode. Auto-cleared when serial mode is exited.

register.description: Controls UTMI+ OTG functions of the PHY. Read/write address.

bitfield.description: Drive 5 V on VBUS
Charge VBUS through a resistor for VBUS-pulsing SRP.
Discharge VBUS through a resistor, until the session-end VBUS state is reached.
Enables the 15-kΩ pulldown resistor on D–

bitenum.description: Pulldown resistor not connected to D–

bitfield.description: Enables the 15-kΩ pulldown resistor on D+

bitenum.description: Pulldown resistor not connected to D+

bitfield.description: Pullup to the (OTG) ID line to allow its sampling

bitfield.description: Pullup to the (OTG) ID line to allow its sampling

register.description: Enables an interrupt event notification when the corresponding status bit changes from low to high. By default, all transitions are enabled. Read/write address.

bitfield.description: Generate an interrupt event notification when IdGnd changes from low to high. Event is automatically masked if IdPullup bit is clear to 0 and for 50ms after IdPullup is set to 1.
Generate an interrupt event notification when SessEnd changes from low to high.
Generate an interrupt event notification when SessValid changes from low to high. SessValid is the same as UTMI+ AValid.
Generate an interrupt event notification when VbusValid changes from low to high.
Generate an interrupt event notification when Hostdisconnect changes from low to high. Applicable only in host mode (DpPulldown and DmPulldown both set to 1b).

register.description: Indicates the current value of the interrupt source signal.

bitfield.description: Value of UTMI+ IdDig output. Undefined unless IdPullup = 1

bitenum.description: ID pin is floating = OTG B = default peripheral
ID pin is grounded = OTG A = default host

bitfield.description: Current value of UTMI+ SessEnd output.
Current value of UTMI+ SessValid output. SessValid is the same as UTMI+ AValid.
Current value of UTMI+ VbusValid output.
Current value of UTMI+ Hostdisconnect output. Applicable only in host mode. Automatically reset to 0 when low-power mode is entered.

bitenum.description: Peripheral not disconnected or nonhost mode

register.description: Indicates the current value of the interrupt source signal.

bitfield.description: Value of UTMI+ IdDig output. Undefined unless IdPullup = 1

bitenum.description: ID pin is floating = OTG B = default peripheral
ID pin is grounded = OTG A = default host

bitfield.description: Current value of UTMI+ SessEnd output.
Current value of UTMI+ SessValid output. SessValid is the same as UTMI+ AValid.
Current value of UTMI+ VbusValid output.
Current value of UTMI+ Hostdisconnect output. Applicable only in host mode. Automatically reset to 0 when low-power mode is entered.

bitenum.description: Peripheral not disconnected or nonhost mode

register.description: Set by unmasked changes on the corresponding status bits to generate the ULPI interrupt. Cleared upon read, and when low-power mode, serial mode, or carkit mode are entered.

bitfield.description: Set to 1 by the PHY when an unmasked event occurs on IdGnd. Cleared when this register is read.
Set to 1 by the PHY when an unmasked event occurs on SessEnd. Cleared when this register is read.
Set to 1 by the PHY when an unmasked event occurs on SessValid. Cleared when this register is read. SessValid is the same as UTMI+ AValid.
Set to 1 by the PHY when an unmasked event occurs on VbusValid. Cleared when this register is read.
Set to 1 by the PHY when an unmasked event occurs on Hostdisconnect. Cleared when this register is read. Applicable only in host mode.

register.description: Set by unmasked changes on the corresponding status bits to generate the ULPI interrupt. Cleared upon read, and when low-power mode, serial mode, or carkit mode are entered.

bitfield.description: Set to 1 by the PHY when an unmasked event occurs on IdGnd. Cleared when this register is read.
Set to 1 by the PHY when an unmasked event occurs on SessEnd. Cleared when this register is read.
Set to 1 by the PHY when an unmasked event occurs on SessValid. Cleared when this register is read. SessValid is the same as UTMI+ AValid.
Set to 1 by the PHY when an unmasked event occurs on VbusValid. Cleared when this register is read.
Set to 1 by the PHY when an unmasked event occurs on Hostdisconnect. Cleared when this register is read. Applicable only in host mode.

register.description: Indicates the current value of various signals useful for debugging.

bitfield.description: Current state of the USB line: D+ (bit 0) and D– (bit 1).

bitenum.description: LS: J state, FS: K state, HS: Invalid, Chirp: !Squelch AND !HS_Differential_Receiver_Output
LS: K state, FS: J state, HS: !Squelch, Chirp: !Squelch AND HS_Differential_Receiver_Output

register.description: Indicates the current value of various signals useful for debugging.

bitfield.description: Current state of the USB line: D+ (bit 0) and D– (bit 1).

bitenum.description: LS: J state, FS: K state, HS: Invalid, Chirp: !Squelch AND !HS_Differential_Receiver_Output
LS: K state, FS: J state, HS: !Squelch, Chirp: !Squelch AND HS_Differential_Receiver_Output

register.description: Register byte for register access testing purposes. Value has no functional effect on PHY. Read/write address.

bitfield.description: Scratch data

register.description: Register byte for register access testing purposes. Value has no functional effect on PHY. Read/clear address (write 1 to a bit to clear it to 0, writing 0 has no effect on bit value). See field description at the read/write address of the same register.

register.description: This address is used to access the extended register set; that is, addresses above 0x40.

bitfield.description: This bit field is used to access the extended register set; that is, addresses above 0x40.

register.description: This address is used to access the extended register set; that is, addresses above 0x40.

bitfield.description: This bit field is used to access the extended register set; that is, addresses above 0x40.

register.description: Part of nonstandard UTMI-to-ULPI mailbox system, implemented if HDL generic VCS_MAILBOX bit is 1 Enables an interrupt notification when the corresponding vcontrol_status bit changes. Read/write address. Lowest VCS_CTRL_WIDTH (HDL generic) bits are implemented, others are always-0, read-only. (UTMI standard is 4-bit.)

bitfield.description: Enable alt_int assertion upon vcontrol_status bit change: Write 0x0: No effect on bit value Write 0x1: Set the bit to 1.
Enable alt_int assertion upon vcontrol_status bit change: Write 0x0: No effect on bit value Write 0x1: Set the bit to 1.
Enable alt_int assertion upon vcontrol_status bit change: Write 0x0: No effect on bit value Write 0x1: Set the bit to 1.

Enable alt_int assertion upon vcontrol_status bit change: Write 0x0: No effect on bit value Write 0x1: Set the bit to 1.
Enable alt_int assertion upon vcontrol_status bit change: Write 0x0: No effect on bit value Write 0x1: Set the bit to 1.
Enable alt_int assertion upon vcontrol_status bit change: Write 0x0: No effect on bit value Write 0x1: Set the bit to 1.

register.description: Part of nonstandard UTMI-to-ULPI mailbox system, implemented if HDL generic VCS_MAILBOX bit is 1. Enables an interrupt notification when the corresponding vcontrol_status bit changes. Read/clear address (write 1 to a bit to clear it to 0, writing 0 has no effect on bit value). See fields description at the read/write address of the same register.

bitfield.description: User-defined UTMI control data byte

register.description: Part of nonstandard UTMI-to-ULPI mailbox system, implemented if HDL generic VCS_MAILBOX bit is 1. Enables an interrupt notification when the corresponding vcontrol_status bit changes. Read/clear address (write 1 to a bit to clear it to 0, writing 0 has no effect on bit value). See fields description at the read/write address of the same register.

bitfield.description: User-defined UTMI control data byte

register.description: Part of nonstandard UTMI-to-ULPI mailbox system, implemented if HDL generic VCS_MAILBOX bit is 1. UTMI-standard Vcontrol vector byte is sent by the UTMI controller (other side of TLL) to its PHY (emulated here by the TLL). Alternatively, data can be also written directly into the register. Can contain any user-defined data. Vcontrol bit changes can be used to assert the ULPI ALT interrupt. Lowest VCS_CTRL_WIDTH (HDL generic) bits are implemented, others are always-0, read-only. (UTMI standard is 4-bit).

bitfield.description: User-defined UTMI Control data byte

register.description: Part of nonstandard UTMI-to-ULPI mailbox system, implemented if HDL generic VCS_MAILBOX bit is 1. UTMI-standard Vcontrol vector byte is sent by the UTMI controller (other side of TLL) to its PHY (emulated here by the TLL). Alternatively, data can be also written directly into the register. Can contain any user-defined data. Vcontrol bit changes can be used to assert the ULPI ALT interrupt. Lowest VCS_CTRL_WIDTH (HDL generic) bits are implemented, others are always-0, read-only. (UTMI standard is 4-bit).

bitfield.description: User-defined UTMI Control data byte

register.description: Part of nonstandard UTMI-to-ULPI mailbox system, implemented if HDL generic VCS_MAILBOX bit is 1. Set by unmasked changes on the corresponding vcontrol_status bits to generate the ULPI ALT interrupt. Cleared upon read, and when low-power mode, serial mode or carkit mode are entered. Lowest VCS_CTRL_WIDTH (HDL generic) bits are implemented, others are always-0, read-only. (UTMI standard is 4-bit.)

register.description: Part of nonstandard UTMI-to-ULPI mailbox system, implemented if HDL generic VCS_MAILBOX bit is 1. UTMI-standard Vstatus vector byte is sent by the PHY (emulated here by the TLL) to the UTMI controller (other side of TLL): information written into this register goes directly to the UTMI controller, and can contain any user-defined data. Read/write address. Lowest VCS_STAT_WIDTH (HDL generic) bits are implemented, others are always-0, read-only. (UTMI standard is 8-bit.)

bitfield.description: User-defined UTMI status data byte

register.description: Part of nonstandard UTMI-to-ULPI mailbox system, implemented if HDL generic VCS_MAILBOX bit is 1. UTMI-standard Vstatus vector byte is sent by the PHY (emulated here by the TLL) to the UTMI controller (other side of TLL): information written into this register goes directly to the UTMI controller, and can contain any user-defined data. Read/write address. Lowest VCS_STAT_WIDTH (HDL generic) bits are implemented, others are always-0, read-only. (UTMI standard is 8-bit.)

bitfield.description: User-defined UTMI status data byte

register.description: Part of nonstandard UTMI-to-ULPI mailbox system, implemented if HDL generic VCS_MAILBOX bit is 1. UTMI-standard Vstatus vector byte is sent by the PHY (emulated here by the TLL) to the UTMI controller (other side of TLL): information written into this register goes directly to the UTMI controller, and can contain any user-defined data. Read/set address (write 1 to a bit to set it to 1, writing 0 has no effect on bit value). See field description at the read/write address of the same register.

bitfield.description: User-defined UTMI status data byte Write 0x0: No effect on bit value Write 0x1: Set the bit to 1.

register.description: Part of nonstandard UTMI-to-ULPI mailbox system, implemented if HDL generic VCS_MAILBOX bit is 1. UTMI-standard Vstatus vector byte is sent by the PHY (emulated here by the TLL) to the UTMI controller (other side of TLL): information written into this register goes directly to the UTMI controller, and can contain any user-defined data. Read/set address (write 1 to a bit to set it to 1, writing 0 has no effect on bit value). See field description at the read/write address of the same register.

bitfield.description: User-defined UTMI status data byte Write 0x0: No effect on bit value Write 0x1: Set the bit to 1.

register.description: Part of nonstandard UTMI-to-ULPI mailbox system, implemented if HDL generic VCS_MAILBOX bit is 1. UTMI-standard Vstatus vector byte is sent by the PHY (emulated here by the TLL) to the UTMI controller (other side of TLL): information written into this register goes directly to the UTMI controller, and can contain any user-defined data. Read/clear address (write 1 to a bit to clear it to 0, writing 0 has no effect on bit value). See field description at the read/write address of the same register.

bitfield.description: User-defined UTMI status data byte: Write 0x0: No effect on bit value Write 0x1: Clear the bit to 0.

register.description: Part of nonstandard UTMI-to-ULPI mailbox system, implemented if HDL generic VCS_MAILBOX bit is 1. UTMI-standard Vstatus vector byte is sent by the PHY (emulated here by the TLL) to the UTMI controller (other side of TLL): information written into this register goes directly to the UTMI controller, and can contain any user-defined data. Read/clear address (write 1 to a bit to clear it to 0, writing 0 has no effect on bit value). See field description at the read/write address of the same register.

bitfield.description: User-defined UTMI status data byte: Write 0x0: No effect on bit value Write 0x1: Clear the bit to 0.

register.description: Set by unmasked changes on the corresponding status bits to generate the ULPI interrupt. Debug, nonstandard address to the standard register: Register is not cleared on read. See field description at the 'clear-on-read' address of the same register.

bitfield.description: Set to 1 by the PHY when an unmasked event occurs on IdGnd.
Set to 1 by the PHY when an unmasked event occurs on SessEnd.
Set to 1 by the PHY when an unmasked event occurs on SessValid. SessValid is the same as UTMI+ AValid.
Set to 1 by the PHY when an unmasked event occurs on VbusValid.
Set to 1 by the PHY when an unmasked event occurs on Hostdisconnect. Applicable only in host mode.

register.description: Set by unmasked changes on the corresponding status bits to generate the ULPI interrupt. Debug, nonstandard address to the standard register: Register is not cleared on read. See field description at the 'clear-on-read' address of the same register.

bitfield.description: Set to 1 by the PHY when an unmasked event occurs on IdGnd.
Set to 1 by the PHY when an unmasked event occurs on SessEnd.
Set to 1 by the PHY when an unmasked event occurs on SessValid. SessValid is the same as UTMI+ AValid.
Set to 1 by the PHY when an unmasked event occurs on VbusValid.
Set to 1 by the PHY when an unmasked event occurs on Hostdisconnect. Applicable only in host mode.

register.description: Vendor-specific interrupt enables (mask) for miscellaneous ULPI alt_int events. Read/write address.

bitfield.description: Enable PHY-to-PHY ULPI wakeup upon inactive UTMI suspendm.

register.description: Vendor-specific interrupt enables (mask) for miscellaneous ULPI alt_int events. Read/write address.

bitfield.description: Enable PHY-to-PHY ULPI wakeup upon inactive UTMI suspendm.

register.description: Vendor-specific interrupt enable bit (mask) for miscellaneous ULPI alt_int events. Read/set address (write 1 to a bit to set it to 1, writing 0 has no effect on bit value). See field description at the read/write address of the same register.

bitfield.description: Enable PHY-to-PHY ULPI wakeup upon inactive UTMI suspendm.

register.description: Vendor-specific interrupt enable bit (mask) for miscellaneous ULPI alt_int events. Read/set address (write 1 to a bit to set it to 1, writing 0 has no effect on bit value). See field description at the read/write address of the same register.

bitfield.description: Enable PHY-to-PHY ULPI wakeup upon inactive UTMI suspendm.

register.description: Vendor-specific interrupt enables (mask) for miscellaneous ULPI alt_int events. Read/clear address (write 1 to a bit to clear it to 0, writing 0 has no effect on bit value). See fields description at the read/write address of the same register.

bitfield.description: Enable PHY-to-PHY ULPI wakeup upon inactive UTMI suspendm.

register.description: Vendor-specific interrupt enables (mask) for miscellaneous ULPI alt_int events. Read/clear address (write 1 to a bit to clear it to 0, writing 0 has no effect on bit value). See fields description at the read/write address of the same register.

bitfield.description: Enable PHY-to-PHY ULPI wakeup upon inactive UTMI suspendm.

register.description: Vendor-specific interrupt sources for miscellaneous ULPI alt_int events

bitfield.description: UTMI suspendm status (active-low), source of TLL PHY-to-PHY wake-up interrupt.

register.description: Vendor-specific interrupt sources for miscellaneous ULPI alt_int events

bitfield.description: UTMI suspendm status (active-low), source of TLL PHY-to-PHY wake-up interrupt.

register.description: Vendor-specific interrupt latches for miscellaneous ULPI alt_int events. Cleared upon read, and when low-power mode, serial mode or carkit mode are entered.

bitfield.description: PHY-to-PHY ULPI wake-up event latch. Set when ULPI is in low-power mode (suspendm = 0) and UTMI is active (suspendm = 1).

bitenum.description: PHY-to-PHY wake-up event was latched, ALT interrupt active.
No PHY-to-PHY wake-up event was latched.

register.description: Vendor-specific interrupt latches for miscellaneous ULPI alt_int events. Cleared upon read, and when low-power mode, serial mode or carkit mode are entered.

bitfield.description: PHY-to-PHY ULPI wake-up event latch. Set when ULPI is in low-power mode (suspendm = 0) and UTMI is active (suspendm = 1).

bitenum.description: PHY-to-PHY wake-up event was latched, ALT interrupt active.
No PHY-to-PHY wake-up event was latched.
